title: 104_hr3595
content: The Santee Sioux Tribe is entitled to a proportionate share of Docket 74-A. The Santee Sioux Tribe's share of the monetary settlement in Docket 74-A will be held in a trust fund by the Secretary of the Interior. The fund's principal will be invested according to the law, and the interest and income earned will be available annually for social, economic programs, and tribal government operations, with 20 percent of the amounts being available each year. 20 percent of the monetary settlement in Docket 74-A will be available annually for economic development, 20 percent for burials, and 60 percent for annual budgeting by the tribal council. Funds cannot be used to acquire land outside the reservation. Tax exemption and resource exemption limitations apply to all distributed funds. The funds held in trust shall not be subject to Federal or State income taxes, nor considered as income or resources for denying benefits under the Social Security Act. The Santee Sioux Tribe must release all claims before receiving funds. All claims by the Santee Sioux Tribe and its members against the United States under Docket 74-A will be extinguished upon release and relinquishment. SEC. 2. APPLICABILITY OF SETTLEMENT TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF SIOUX INDIAN NATION IN DOCKETS 74-A AND 74-B, IF SETTLED. If the Sioux Indian Nation accepts the settlement in both Dockets 74-A and 74-B, all remaining funds will be subject to general terms and conditions applicable to the Sioux Indian Nation. The term "Sioux Indian Nation" includes various tribes such as the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe, Crow Creek Sioux Tribe, and Oglala Sioux Tribe, among others. The Sioux Indian Nation includes tribes such as the Santee Sioux Tribe, Standing Rock Sioux Tribe, and Sioux Tribe of the Fort Peck Reservation. The curr_chunk is a section header "SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS." which indicates that definitions will be provided in the following text. The curr_chunk provides definitions for key terms used in the Act, including "Santee Sioux Tribe," "Docket 74-A," and "proportionate share." These definitions clarify specific references and percentages related to the Treaty of April 29, 1868. The "Research Report" from October 1989 defines key terms such as "fund" as the Santee Sioux Tribe Docket 74-A Fund and "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior.
